author: By Jeanne Cooper
title: It’s Picasso in Vegas, baby!
text: It’s Picasso in Vegas, baby! Jeanne Coope , San Francisco Chronicle By Jeanne Cooper Published 1:08 am, Thursday, July 16, 2015 Tonga's new 100 note is one of a series of bills featuring the recently crowned King Tupou VI on the obverse and cultural images on the reverse. A “greatroom”-style lobby where pilgrims to Mecca can relax is part of the first-ever Marriott in the Saudi Arabian city, the Makkah Marriott Hotel. Picasso’s 1962 oil painting “Woman Wearing Yellow Hat (Jacqueline)” is among his works on view through Jan. 10 at the Bellagio Gallery of Fine Art in Las Vegas. The 19th century red-brick Gothic architecture of Hamburg’s Speicherstadt district, including this administration building by the St. Annenfleet canal, has earned a World Heritage Site designation from UNESCO.
